data.title: When user settings is opened, focus should default to search input
data.body: Almost every time I open user settings, I'm going to search for a command.  It would be a better flow if the focus would default to the search input box.

data.title: When extensions panel is opened, focus should default to search input
data.body: Whenever I open the extensions panel, my first action is to search for something.  However, the focus does not start in the search input box.

data.title: Provide ability to view only changed lines in compare diff view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
1.  For some types of comparisons, this provides a much quicker and easier view of the changes when common lines are filtered out.
2. There are times when is is useful to be able to select and copy the text of only the changes

data.title: VS Code Freezing With 2+ Projects Open
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.9.1
- Mac OS Version: 10.12.3 

I only have the C/C++ and C# extensions. I primarily write in JavaScript (Node/Express/Angular/React) with VS Code.

1. `code .`
2. VS Code "shell" opens and freezes (about every 2 - 4 times, especially with 2+ projects open)

Not sure how to reproduce for you but about every 2 - 4 times I open VS Code, it simply freezes (it will open the VS Code shell but the sidebar, my files, etc won't show up. Just the shell, where it freezes.) and sometimes I have a hard time force-quitting it. The only way to get it working again is to force quit, but then I quit out of all of my other open projects. I have tested it out on both iTerm and Terminal but the issue still persists. It is worse if I have 2+ apps in other VS Code windows open. It's been going on for about 1 - 2 weeks. Let me know if I can provide anymore details and/or what I can do to resolve this issue if it's on my end. Thanks guys.

- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Tslint Rules
```json
{
   "rules" : {
       "quotemark" : [
          true,
          "single"
        ]
    }
}
```

2. Use the new auto import feature 

3.  The import is added with double quotes (instead of single quotes)

The import should be added with matching quotes with respect to tslint.json

data.title: Add ability to display high intensity ANSI colors in debug console

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The debug console honors ANSI color codes embedded in strings, but it treats high intensity color codes the same as low intensity, i.e., dark colors. It would be useful if the high intensity color codes generated the high intensity colors. I realize that using ANSI color codes in the debug console is an undocumented feature, but it is a very useful one. See the screenshot below for an example of how my debugger/extension uses them to do syntax highlighting of code evaluated in a REPL.

![Imgur](http://i.imgur.com/gKRCxqj.png)

Although the syntax highlighting is better than no highlighting, it would be even better if the colors were brighter and a better match for the syntax highlighting in the editor. Please allow high intensity color codes to display as such in the debug console.

data.title: vscode "phones home" upon startup with updates and telemetry disabled
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

I've noticed that vscode (both the normal and insiders versions) tries to connect to ```ms-vscode.gallery.vsassets.io``` (and sometimes other marketplace related domains) upon every startup even with update channel and telemetry disabled. 

This only affects versions packaged by Microsoft - a locally built "Code - OSS" does not have this issue. 

Related config parameters: 
```
"telemetry.enableCrashReporter": false,
"telemetry.enableTelemetry": false,
"update.channel": "none"
```
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1, 1.10.0
- OS Version: macOS any version

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start vscode non OSS version

data.title: Feature Request: OpenTextDocument with content
data.body:
#12283 added an api overload to open a new, untitled text document with an optional language mode.

It would be great if this could be augmented to accept content.

Use case: I have an extension that ships with examples. Currently I have to do one of the following:

- Open the "source" file directly which would allow users to clobber it
- Copy the file to a temp file and open that and then remember to clean it up. Users would still have to "save as" to save it in a location that is useful to them
- Use the new overload to open an untitled, empty text document and then use an edit to populate the contents.

The last one is the most viable but seems unnecessary. I would like to see `openTextDocument(options?: {language: id, content: text})` so I could do something like 

```
openTextDocument(exampleUri).then(exampleDocument => { const exampleText = exampleDocument.getText(); openTextDocument({language: LANG_ID, content: exampleText})
```

data.title: Avoid request id collisions in pendingRPCReplies
data.body: lastMessageId should have same scope as pendingRPCReplies so different calls to createRPC can't have request id collisions.

data.title: Can language services keep a changelog?
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

For html/css/json-language-service, it's a bit hard to keep track of what's happening in each service by going through all the commits.

Would be great if there is a high-level changelog that briefly talks about changes in each versions. So language server authors can adopt & update as they see fit.

@aeschli

data.title: Enhancement: Minimap position highlight

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.0-insiders (2017-02-24)
- OS Version: Windows 10

I have some enhancement requests for the current minimap implementation which are already available in `Atom` as separate plugins.

1. Enable the minimap in latest insider build and position your cursor in the editor. The minimap does not highlight (ligh grey background) your current position unless you hover over the minimap. I would like this highlight to be enabled at all time. 
    * This should probably be added as an extra editor setting.
2. Add CSS color display in the minimap, this is available in `Atom` as a separate plugin `minimap-pigments` which I find very convenient. 
3. Highlight the text in the editor would also highlight the text in the minimap. This is only available in `Sublime Text` and has a white background (instead of grey).

Out of the three requests, the number 1) is the most wanted.

![atom_minimap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/643976/23327490/02c50eb6-fadb-11e6-9d5b-6b23828d774d.jpg)

data.title: Feature request: shortcut for: Toggle dotfiles invisible in sidebar
data.body: This would be really helpful when opening large trees of packages with many dotfiles.

data.title: Independent Minimap Scroll On Mouse Wheel Events

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0 - insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

-- Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

Option to enable and disable: Independent Minimap Scroll On Mouse Wheel Events

When enabled, using the mouse wheel over the Minimap will make it scroll independently of the text editor. The Minimap will still sync with the editor whenever the editor is scrolled, but it will no longer relay the mouse wheel events to the editor. Like Atom.

![68747470733a2f2f6769746875622e636f6d2f61746f6d2d6d696e696d61702f6d696e696d61702f626c6f622f6d61737465722f7265736f75726365732f696e646570656e64656e742d7363726f6c6c2e6769663f7261773d74727565](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19866231/23325489/78690be2-fad4-11e6-9d7e-fd829c675e78.gif)

data.title: Move lines actions are not multicursor aware

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

The issues title could be rename properly 

Ok this on is a bit weird but it's a weird stuff I was doing

In fact, I was regrouping with the multiple line cursor

For the purpose I will give you a "File" (multiple line in the description)

The weird stuff happen with the lines with this KeyWord "WeirdStuffHappenOnThoseLine"

So I give you the example that work well at first and after I will write the instruction that doesn't work as expected

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Double click on "WhatEverStuff" to select the keyword
2. Ctrl + F (Open the find tools bar)
3. Alt + Enter (Select all "WhatEverStuff")
4. After select all, 
     * Press Alt + Arrow Up Multiple time until every "WhatEverStuff" is at the beginning of the files

**For now every "WhatEverStuff" is regroup and no problem have happen right now !!!**

5. Double click on "WeirdStuffHappenOnThoseLine" to select the keyword
6. Ctrl + F (Open the find tools bar)
7. Alt + Enter (Select all "WeirdStuffHappenOnThoseLine")
8. After select all, 
     * Press Alt + Arrow Up until everything is at the beginning of the folder

## But you will see that only the first "WeirdStuffHappenOnThoseLine" of each 3 following Keyword has goes down

So you need to Restart step 7 and step 8 two times again to make it regroup and it's no more the same as I would expect to work (every 3 following keyword should goes down at the same time)


File Here : 
```
WhatEverStuff
WorkingStuff         
WeirdStuffHappenOnThoseLine 1  
WeirdStuffHappenOnThoseLine 2  
WeirdStuffHappenOnThoseLine 3
```
